alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:38AM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 5000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting 50 to 65 mph in the morning, decreasing to 40 to 50 mph in the afternoon. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Grand Canyon and North Rim. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow with blizzard like conditions are likely. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 11 PM Today: Grand Canyon 2 to 4 inches North Rim 4 to 6 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
